name: addresses-linked-to-precincts-jul-2016
title: Addresses in Russia linked to precincts, July 2016
description: 17 million addresses extracted from CEC voting location search service as of July 2016

resources.name: 0. Readme
resources.description: info on data origin and content

resources.name: 1. Address tree in JSON format by regions
resources.description:
Raw JSONs returned by http://www.cikrf.ru/services/lk_tree/id=xxxxx
Collected in June-July 2016

resources.name: 2. Address objects with associated electoral commissions
resources.description:
Address objects with full address and data of associated election commission in JSON format
Election commission data was retrieved from http://www.cikrf.ru/services/lk_address/'intid'?do=result ; for multi-apartment addresses, 'intid' of the 1st apartment was used

resources.name: 3. UIKs (precincts) with associated addresses
resources.description: List of ~93000 UIKs with all associated addresses and number of flats at that address

resources.name: 4. UIKs (precincts) with address/flat statistics
resources.description: List of ~93000 UIKs with flat statistics {'#of flats':'# of addresses'}

resources.name: 5. List of addresses and corresponding UIK number by region
resources.description:
List of addresses and corresponding UIK numbers by region in tab delimited format
Address components with erroneous address level field (obviously originating from a database fault and looking like intid's) are put in addr_16 level. This level also contains the only 1 real (and slightly mysterious) address component related to an address in Ust'-Kamenogorsk region in Kazakhstan pertaining to a precinct in Tomsk region.

resources.name: 6. List of addresses and corresponding UIK numbers for the whole Russia
resources.description:
List of addresses and corresponding UIK numbers for the whole Russia, tab delimited (17 M rows)
Address components with erroneous address level field (obviously originating from a database fault and looking like intid's) are put in addr_16 level. This level also contains the only 1 real (and slightly mysterious) address component related to an address in Ust'-Kamenogorsk region in Kazakhstan pertaining to a precinct in Tomsk region.
